intro: Hibbertia crinita, commonly known as the silky hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, silky-haired stems and leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, often appearing in late winter to early spring. Hibbertia crinita thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is typically found in coastal regions. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1 meter in height, making it a notable feature in its native habitat.
